profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description: At Utrecht University of Applied Sciences (HU) I work as a senior researcher and project leader of different research projects focused on housing and support for homeless people, with a specific focus on Housing First. My work also focuses on the prevention of homelessness, on social integration, and on destigmatisation of homelessness. In addition to my work as a researcher I work as a teacher in the Social Work Master Community Development and in a course on Housing First for professionals in the fields of housing and social care, which I developed with a colleague and with foundation Housing First Nederland.
profile_positions.title: Senior Researcher at Utrecht University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.description: Farent Social Work is a large organisation for welfare and social work in Den Bosch and ten surrounding municipalities. The society and the problems we encounter here are constantly changing. I work with the management team, the social workers, clients, social partners and municipalities to strengthen the existing programs and to develop and implement new programs for assistance and support. It is our purpose that the help and support we offer meets the needs of our clients and residents. I advise the management team of Farent on policy and practice. I work organisation wide, but I also have specific areas of focus such as poverty and debt (debt relief), stress sensitive social work, complex separations, the connection between care and education, outreach work and crisis interventions outside office hours.
profile_positions.title: Management Consultant Development and Innovation

profile_positions.description: De Tussenvoorziening provides shelter, supported housing and debt counseling to people in a vulnerable position in Utrecht, the Netherlands. The organisation counts about 750 staff members of which fifty percent are volunteers. The Supervisory Board monitors the basis, vision and objectives of the organization, approves the strategic policy, the budget, and annual accounts, and supervises the president of the organisation. Within the Supervisory Board I had the portfolio of Safety and Quality and Scientific Research.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Supervisory Board

company.name: Impuls - Onderzoekscentrum maatschappelijke zorg van het Radboudumc

profile_positions.company: Impuls - Onderzoekscentrum maatschappelijke zorg van het Radboudumc
profile_positions.description:
Impuls is the Scientific Research Centre for Social Care of the Radboud University Medical Centre in Nijmegen. The organisation gathers and disseminates research knowledge on populations and subpopulations of people in society who have multiple, complex problems, as well as on processes of social exclusion and social participation. Impuls also plays a pivotal role in two academic collaborative centres that work in the social domain. The interchange between practice-based knowledge, systematic research knowledge and public policy within the collaborative centres gives a powerful impulse to professionalisation and quality improvement in health and social care. 

During my time at Impuls I executed scientific, practise based research, I developed interventions in co-creation with people with lived-experience, I was president of and coordinated the Dutch National Housing First Platform, I coordinated the Academic Collaborative Centre for Public Mental Health, I was concerned with project aquisition and I provided workshops, trainings, and presentations at (international) conferences.
profile_positions.title: Researcher and Coordinator of the National Housing First Platform

profile_positions.description:
For CREMIS, part of the University of Montreal, Canada, I have contributed to an international literature review about interactions between police and vulnerable groups, and about collaborative interventions between police and social or (mental) health professionals to counteract 'problematic behaviour' of vulnerable groups in the public space.

Related article: http://csp.sagepub.com/content/early/2014/04/07/0261018314527716.full.pdf+html
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
I conducted research on debt counseling and imminent eviction of tenants in the City of Utrecht. Specifically, we aimed to find out why clients of the municipal credit bank dropped out of their trajectories in an early phase, and were not able to make use of the help offered. We also focused on tenants with rent arrears who took part in the project 'Prevent Evictions' (Voorkom Huisuitzetting!), a specific project that aims to prevent the eviction of vulnerable tenants in the City of Utrecht. We aimed to find out which support needs they had, and how they experienced the help they received. 

http://eropaf.org/lib/publicaties///2011%20%20Schuldhulpverlening%202%20DEFINITIEF.pdf
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description: At the Sleep Inn, night shelter for homeless people, I was responsible for the services provided to 55-75 homeless people. I was responsible for the reception and intake of new visitors, for the administration, for securing a safe atmosphere, and for conflict resolution. I also provided social support, and I directed the evening team of volunteers.
profile_positions.title: Staff member at a shelter for homeless people

profile_positions.description:
In Oakland, California, I have conducted a M.Sc. research project on the Homeless Outreach and Stabilization Team (HOST) of Bonita House Inc., which provides Housing First services to 90 individuals with dual diagnoses and histories of long term homelessness. The study had a qualitative character and aimed to explain how participation in a Housing First programme influences the social networks, social integration and social positions of chronically homeless people. Research activities included in depth interviews with both team members and clients, and participant observation in outreach activities for the recruitment of new clients, home visits, staff meetings, support groups, and social activities. 

http://dare.uva.nl/document/200019
profile_positions.title: Researcher

company.name: Straatnieuws dak- en thuislozen krant Utrecht en omgeving

profile_positions.description: I conducted research on the willingness and motivation of homeless people in Utrecht to sell the homeless newspaper 'Straatnieuws'. I interviewed a large number of homeless people at different shelters and living facilities in Utrecht, whereby they were asked about their needs and wishes for work and daily activities, their attitudes towards selling a street newspaper and working for Straatnieuws, and their ideas about possible alternatives for homeless people.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description: I provided classes in the course 'Homelessness: Policy and Interventions', to students of the study Interdisciplinary Social Sciences. I was responsible for the selection of teaching materials, and provided trainings in qualitative interviewing. Further, I coached my students during their first research experience 'in the field'. Commissioned by knowledge institute MOVISIE, we conducted research on care for homeless people in the Netherlands. We aimed to explore to what extent service providers gave attention to the personal drives and goals of their clients, and how this effected the outcomes of clients' trajectories.
profile_positions.title: University Teacher

profile_positions.description: I conducted research on the prevention of and approach to family homelessness in the Netherlands, whereby I was responsible for the part of the study that focused on the situation in the City of Amsterdam. Research activities included among other things desk research concerning literature and policy on (family) homelessness in Amsterdam, and in depth interviews with local stakeholders (such as the City of Amsterdam, the municipal health service, a shelter for homeless families, and the local federation of housing associations). The study was commissioned by the Dutch Federation of Shelters.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description: In Utrecht, the Netherlands, I have conducted an extended qualitative study on the living situation of homeless people. I aimed to explore how homeless people themselves experienced their position in society, and how this influenced their attitudes and behavior. Research activities included literature study, in depth interviews with homeless and formerly homeless people, and participant observation in different shelters, soup kitchens, and day centers. I have also spent some days with homeless people on the streets. The research was part of my final project for the BSc study of Interdisciplinary Social Sciences.
profile_positions.title: Student Researcher

volunteer_experiences.description: As a visiting volunteer I make regular visits and provide social support to a patient of a Forensic Psychiatric Clinic (TBS) in Nijmegen, the Netherlands.

Esther's Eethuis is a social restaurant in the neighborhood Overvecht in Utrecht. Volunteers and guests cook and eat together, and after dinner there is time for coffee, conversations, and games. Our guests have in common that their social networks are limited and that they are looking for companionship and social contacts.
As a volunteer of this buddy project I provide social support to a formerly homeless man. We undertake different social activities together aimed to increase social participation.

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer at shelter for homeless people
volunteer_experiences.description: I worked as a staff member at the biggest night shelter for homeless individuals and families in Valencia, Spain (70 beds). I was responsible for the intake and reception of new clients, I provided practical and social support, and I was responsible for securing a safe atmosphere.

At this NGO I provided assistance to immigrants in Valencia, Spain, focused on their social integration. I assisted them in dealing with the difficulties they faced in their integration process, and helped to develop and organize courses and activities focused on social participation.

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer at Het Smulhuis, restaurant for homeless people
volunteer_experiences.description: Together with other volunteers, I cooked for 60 homeless people a day. I also had dinner with them, and provided social support. Further, I was responsible for securing a safe atmosphere and for conflict resolution.
I participated in several campaigns aimed to increase the awareness of social problems in developing countries and to enhance the knowledge of international collaboration on development.
